title: Macron voices support for Zelensky, says he'll urge Trump against being 'weak' with Putin
summary: In a live question session on his social media accounts, the French president said Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky had been 'elected in a free system.' Macron is due to go to Washington on Monday, according to the White House.

title: 'The America of the rule of law and the liberal international order is disappearing'
summary: Donald Trump extends the powers of the American presidency beyond what any of his predecessors had ever dared, says Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Israel demands Hamas return Shiri Bibas' body, saying the militant group handed over an unknown person
summary: The militants said it was handing over the remains of the wife and two children of Yarden Bibas, as well as the body of Oded Lifshitz. The bodies had yet to be identified, and Israel later accused the Palestinian militant group of having handed over the body of an unknown person rather than that of the hostage Shiri Bibas.

title: Trump and Tiger Woods hold court at the White House for Black History Month event after scrapped DEI programs
summary: The ceremony, attended by hundreds of guests in the East Room, comes as the US president has pushed to eradicate diversity programs from the government, labeling DEI 'discrimination.' In the wake of his executive order, the Defense Department issued guidance declaring 'identity months dead,' such as Black History Month, Women's History Month and National Disability Employment Awareness Month.

title: New York governor won't remove NYC mayor for now, but plans to increase oversight of City Hall
summary: The decision came after Governor Kathy Hochul solicited opinions this week from a roster of New York political figures over questions about whether Eric Adams could independently govern following the Justice Department's move to drop his federal corruption case, and his controversial relationship with the Trump administration.

title: 'Cats and Dogs': The Cité des sciences et de l'Industrie in Paris is putting pets in their place
summary: The exhibition, which opened on February 18, invites visitors age 6 and over to gain a better understanding of the physical performance of our four-legged friends and to dive into their minds.

title: Behind the Trump offensive, a muted struggle for control of strategic metals
summary: Geopolitical and trade tensions resulting from the new US policy are also destabilizing critical minerals markets, while green transition metals had a dismal year in 2024.

title: US Republican ex-senate leader Mitch McConnell announces leaving Senate
summary: After serving seven terms and earning a reputation for his political maneuvers in Congress, Mitch McConnell, 83, in increasingly fragile health, announced that he would not seek reelection next year.

title: Victor Wembanyama expected to miss rest of NBA season due to health issue
summary: A statement by the French star player's team, the San Antonio Spurs, said that Victor Wembanyama had been diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis in his right shoulder, which usually precludes playing contact sports.

title: France adopts 'one of the most ambitious' laws on PFAS
summary: French MPs have adopted a bill to protect the public from the risks associated with forever chemicals. It bans their use in three product categories and imposes a charge on industrial water discharges under the 'polluter pays' principle.

title: US aid freeze fuels fears of renewed AIDS epidemic: 'People are going to die'
summary: Despite the waiver granted by the US, the global system for fighting HIV – which still causes 630,000 deaths a year, 60% of them in Africa – has been shaken.

title: Spanish court fines ex-football chief €10,800 over non-consensual kiss
summary: Luis Rubiales has been found guilty of sexually assaulting the footballer Jenni Hermoso after Spain's victory at the Women's World Cup final in 2023. Rubiales' lawyer said her client has decided to appeal the ruling.

title: After Trump's attacks on Zelensky, Europeans seek to influence upcoming negotiations
summary: On the sidelines of a second mini-summit in Paris, European leaders expressed concern that America would quickly give in to Russian demands. Emmanuel Macron could be going to Washington as early as Monday.

title: US appeals court upholds block on Trump's order to end birthright citizenship
summary: One of the executive orders Donald Trump made when he took power, it tries to redefine the 14th Amendment to the US Constitution, which decrees that anyone born on US soil is a citizen.

title: Javier Milei and the crypto scandal revealing large-scale manipulation
summary: The Argentinian president faces political backlash after he promoted a cryptocurrency whose value quickly plummeted. It was launched under suspicious circumstances by a young American claiming to be an 'adviser.'

title: Without the US, Ukraine would barely last six months against Russia
summary: Experts believe that military aid from Washington is essential to Kyiv's resistance to Moscow's military advance.

title: 'A dictator without elections': Watch Trump's attacks against Zelensky
summary: After initial attacks published on his Truth Social platform on Wednesday, the US president reiterated his comments during a speech in Miami.

title: Amazon takes creative control of James Bond franchise ending decades of family control
summary: The deal is a major shift in the governance of one of cinema's most valuable properties, with longtime producers Michael Wilson and Barbara Broccoli stepping back.

title: Cryolite, a rare mineral, is rekindling tensions between Greenland and Denmark
summary: A documentary estimates that exploitation of this 'white gold' has earned companies and the Danish state €54 billion. While the figures are disputed by economists, they're fueling pro-independence rhetoric in Nuuk.

title: US Senate confirms Trump loyalist Kash Patel to head FBI
summary: The Senate has approved all of Trump's cabinet picks so far, underscoring his iron grip on the Republican Party.

title: In Syria, a climate of purge in the public sector
summary: The new Syrian authorities claim to be hunting down fictitious jobs. Opponents denounce political motives.

title: Why is French prime minister Bayrou under fire over accusations of abuse in a Catholic school?
summary: Former pupils of a Catholic school in the Pyrenées have complained of sexual and physical abuse, and François Bayrou, who has ties to the school, has been accused by political opponents of dishonesty over his knowledge of the allegations.

title: 'Xi Jinping wants to loosen the reins on the private sector, after years of reining them in'
summary: For a decade, the Chinese president has showered state-owned companies with subsidies. But moribund growth and many private companies' status as world leaders are forcing him to change the balance of power, explains Philippe Escande, economic columnist at Le Monde.

title: The man accused of stabbing Salman Rushdie declines to take the stand as the defense rests
summary: Hadi Matar, 27, is on trial in western New York on charges of attempted murder and assault. In court, his lawyers sought to challenge prosecution witnesses to cast doubt on whether Matar intended to kill, and not just injure, author Salmon Rushdie, 77, in 2022. Rushdie was stabbed and slashed more than a dozen times in the head, throat, torso, thigh and hand in an unprovoked attack.

title: Mexico says won't accept US 'invasion' in fight against cartels
summary: President Claudia Sheinbaum said Mexico would expand its legal action against US gun manufacturers, which her government accuses of negligence in the sale of weapons that end up in the hands of drug traffickers. The lawsuit could lead to a new charge of alleged 'complicity' with terrorist groups, she said.

title: War in Ukraine affects start of Polish presidential campaign
summary: The debate over the hypothetical dispatch of troops to support Kyiv is embarrassing Warsaw, as Polish citizens go to the polls on May 18.
